Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server class in Java using the org.java_websocket library to handle client connections, messages, disconnections, and errors.

Class Description: The WSocketServer class extends WebSocketServer to create a custom WebSocket server that manages client connections and communication. It handles lifecycle events including connection opening, message reception, connection closing, and errors. The server can broadcast messages to all connected clients.

Attributes:
- Inherited attributes from WebSocketServer (base class handles socket connections and client management)

Methods:
- Constructor: WSocketServer(int port) throws UnknownHostException - Creates a server instance bound to the specified port.
- Constructor: WSocketServer(InetSocketAddress address) - Creates a server instance bound to the specified socket address.
- onOpen: onOpen(WebSocket conn, ClientHandshake handshake) -> void - Handles new client connections and sends a handshake confirmation.
- onClose: onClose(WebSocket conn, int code, String reason, boolean remote) -> void - Handles client disconnections and notifies other clients.
- onMessage: onMessage(WebSocket conn, String message) -> void - Processes incoming messages from clients and echoes them back.
- onError: onError(WebSocket conn, Exception ex) -> void - Handles errors occurring during WebSocket operations.
- sendToClient: sendToClient(String text) -> void - Broadcasts a message to all connected clients (thread-safe operation).
